title: iOS: no touch.exit event fired
body:
When overriding the OnTouch function in iOS, and the touch moves outside the view, there is never any touch event fired. Thus, it's impossible to tell if the finger has been released or not.

This is a Xamarin.Forms project and I do not see this problem in Android or UWP.

My view is inside a Master-Detail page, so it's possible that the Master-Detail hijacked the touch event, but then we should get a touch-cancelled event. I'll see if I have time to create a reproduction later this week, but it's pretty simple to create.

comments.author: mattleibow
sonic1015
comments.body: Thanks for the workaround and commitment to investigate. Sorry I didn't get a change to create a repo. Thinking about it further, it's possible this bug happens on the other platforms, but because there Master-Detail Behavior is different, it's not hijacking the touch event.

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body: Based on the Xamarin.Forms team feedback, there is no way to intercept the Master/Detail gestures. The only way now is to either disable gestures globally, or to disable as soon as you start processing them somewhere else - such as when in a list view or other scrolling view.
